div.p: Rational PureCoverage collects a detailed set of coverage data for your program and every component it uses. With this data, you can help ensure that the program you test has been tested properly before you release it.

More information can be found at:
Using Rational PureCoverage
Using PureCoverage power features
PureCoverage User's Guide
@PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin calls the PureCoverage tool via command line and passes the user-provided parameters.
@PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin allows the proper testing of programms.

ElectricFlow itself provides some advantages like parameters checking, easy functionality selection using only check boxes, combo buttons, historical log reports, procedure duration statistics, simple credentials attachment, real time analysis of the log been generated, among others.
This plugin was developed and tested with PureCoverage version 7.0.1.0.
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.

tr.td: Rational PureCoverage executable path
Provide the absolute path to the Coverage executable. Default value assumes Coverage.exe is loaded in the system path. This path cannot contain spaces. (Required)
Platform
Provide the platform on which the target was built. Either a Java program, a .NET framework, or any other platform. (Required)
Target to analyze
Provide the absolute path to the element to analyze.
Platform-related specific parameters

Provide specific parameters that allow the selected target to be executed. This works as a command-line for the selected platform. For example, if Java is selected, this field must contain a relevant command line to allow the program to be executed (java -jar [target] or something similar).
Source path
Specify the search path to use to locate source files to display in your default editor or in the Purify viewer window.
Auto-merge data
If checked, this enables the auto-merge data mode.
Result file type
Indicate the type of archive the log will be saved as, either plain text or a PureCoverage data file.
Result filename
Indicate the filename of the resulting log file.
Additional Commands
Provide any additional commands to be executed for PureCoverage.
Working directory
Provide the desired working directory. Leave blank to use the default workspace.

ul.li: Plugin converted into the new maven format.
